result.execSummary:
The defendant Julius Wayne Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court ordered DNA surcharge waived as a DNA sample was not taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

*Pay back Milwaukee County for attorney fees.*
No contact with victim, except phone contact, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Referral to the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julius Wayne Henderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the AFTES payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Referral to the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, except phone contact, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court ordered DNA surcharge waived as a DNA sample was not taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Pay back Milwaukee County for attorney fees.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/01/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for final pre-trial.  Attorney Rupich did not appear. Courted ordered case adjourned for a new final pre-trial date in Branch 40.   Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 04/02/2015 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 06/01/2015.
Court ordered C.B.H. (DOB 10/02/04) removed from the no contact order.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Patrick Rupich as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Rupich accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 6/01/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BENITA C. AND C.B.H. (10/2/04).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Julius Wayne Henderson
Current: 2337 N 15TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 03-13-2015)
Prior: 2543 South 71st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53219

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 40.

Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Julius Wayne Henderson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge FLANAGAN.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge DALLET, Br. 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
